item.title: Lauren add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I want to do something splendid...something heroic or wonderful that won't be forgotten after I'm dead. I don't know what, but I'm on the watch for it and mean to astonish you all someday." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The greatest compliment that was ever paid me was when one asked me what I thought, and attended to my answer." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I like good strong words that mean something…" -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "How long have you been holding those words in your head, hoping to use them?" -- John Locke

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "Education begins the gentleman, but reading, good company and reflection must finish him." -- John Locke

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Thomas E. Woods Jr.
item.description: "The idea of formulated 'rights ... comes not from John Locke and Thomas Jefferson ... but from the canon law of the Catholic Church. " -- Thomas E. Woods Jr.

item.title: Lauren add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Does a man of sense run after every silly tale of hobgoblins or fairies, and canvass particularly the evidence? I never knew anyone, that examined and deliberated about nonsense who did not believe it before the end of his enquiries." -- David Hume

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The town was paper, but the memories were not." -- John Green

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "I'm convinced that you never have to give up liberties to be safe. I think you're less safe when you give up your liberties." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Lauren add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Amanda Hocking
item.description: "While it did smash, breaking a bottle over someone’s head requires a lot more force than movies had led me to believe." -- Amanda Hocking

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Amanda Hocking
item.description: "This is the way the world ends; not with a bang or a whimper, but with zombies breaking down the back door." -- Amanda Hocking

item.title: Lauren add a quote by St. Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "The Study of philosophy is not that we may know what men have thought, but what the truth of things is. " -- St. Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Saint Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever." -- Saint Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "To love truth for truth's sake is the principal part of human perfection in this world, and the seed-plot of all other virtues." -- John Locke

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "On matters of style, swim with the current, on matters of principle, stand like a rock." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "Bad men need nothing more to compass their ends, than that good men should look on and do nothing." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Peace, commerce, and honest friendship with all nations...entangling alliances with none" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Lauren add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men. It has God for its Author, salvation for its end, and truth without any mixture for its matter. It is all pure, all sincere; nothing too much; nothing wanting!" -- John Locke

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Milton Friedman
item.description: "A society that puts equality before freedom will get neither. A society that puts freedom before equality will get a high degree of both." -- Milton Friedman

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A bore is someone who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only good thing to do with good advice is pass it on; it is never of any use to oneself." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "This wallpaper is dreadful, one of us will have to go." -- Oscar Wilde
